global.title: U-Dig It AI Funnel Testing Playbook
global.description: Frameworks for A/B tests, multivariate tests, and canary launches across funnels, pages, and ads.
global.guardrails: All tests must run with clear KPIs and sufficient sample size before drawing conclusions.

ab_test.description: Compare two variations (A vs B) to measure impact of one change.
examples: Landing page headline: 'Save 10 Hours/Week' vs 'Boost Productivity With AI'
CTA button color: Gold vs Green

multivariate_test.description: Test multiple variables at once (e.g., headline + CTA + testimonial placement).
examples: 3 headline variations x 2 CTA buttons = 6 versions
Testimonials above vs below CTA with different proof styles

canary_launch.description: Roll out a new funnel variant to a small % of traffic before scaling.
examples: 10% of visitors see new Growth Accelerator offer
Beta-testing AI Mastery Hub upsell flow with early adopters

kpis.conversion_rate: Percentage of visitors who complete the funnel action.
kpis.bounce_rate: Percentage of visitors who leave without engaging.
kpis.click_through_rate: Percentage who click CTA vs total views.
kpis.customer_feedback: Qualitative survey results tied to funnel variations.

best_practices.sample_size: Run tests until 95% confidence is reached, minimum 500 visitors per variant.
best_practices.test_duration: At least 7 days to account for weekday/weekend differences.
best_practices.one_variable_rule: For A/B, test one element at a time to isolate impact.
best_practices.documentation: All tests logged in reporting dashboard (see File 17).

integration.reporting_hook: All test results must be exported to reporting_dashboard_spec.json
integration.automation_rules: If Variant B > Variant A by 20%+, promote B to default after test concludes.
